Major Edward Arunah Dunlop1

M, #597592

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Major Edward Arunah Dunlop is the son of Hon. Edward Arunah Dunlop.2 He married Dorothy Joyce Tupper, daughter of Sir Charles Tupper, 3rd Bt. and Mary Mira Douglas Dickey, on 12 August 1944.1

He gained the rank of Major in the Queen's Own Rifles Canada.1 He was awarded the George Medal (G.M.)1 He was appointed Officer, Order of the British Empire (O.B.E.)1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3956. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Edward Arunah Dunlop1

M, #597593, b. 1946

Last Edited=28 Oct 2012

Edward Arunah Dunlop was born in 1946.1 He is the son of Major Edward Arunah Dunlop and Dorothy Joyce Tupper.2 He married Valerine Glen Hardacre in 1976.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3956. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Valerine Glen Hardacre1

F, #597594

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Valerine Glen Hardacre married Edward Arunah Dunlop, son of Major Edward Arunah Dunlop and Dorothy Joyce Tupper, in 1976.1

From 1976, her married name became Dunlop.

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3956. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Charlotte Mary Ferguson Dunlop1

F, #597595, b. 1949

Last Edited=28 Oct 2012

Charlotte Mary Ferguson Dunlop was born in 1949.1 She is the daughter of Major Edward Arunah Dunlop and Dorothy Joyce Tupper.2

Sir James Macdonald Tupper, 4th Bt.1

M, #597596, b. 22 December 1887, d. 23 June 1967

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Sir James Macdonald Tupper, 4th Bt. was born on 22 December 1887.1 He is the son of Hon. Sir Charles Hibbert Tupper and Janet Macdonald.2 He married Agnes Jean Collins on 26 March 1928.1 He died on 23 June 1967 at age 79.1

He was Assistant Commissioner of Royal Canadian Mounted Police in 1941.1 He succeeded as the 4th Baronet Tupper, of Armdale, Halifax, Nova Scotia [U.K., 1888] on 19 June 1962.1

Children of Sir James Macdonald Tupper, 4th Bt. and Agnes Jean Collins

Janet Mary Tupper+2 b. 28 Feb 1929, d. Apr 2015

Sir Charles Hibbert Tupper, 5th Bt.+2 b. 4 Jul 1930, d. 25 May 2008

Reginald Hibbert Tupper1

M, #597597, b. 25 October 1893

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Reginald Hibbert Tupper was born on 25 October 1893.1 He was the son of Hon. Sir Charles Hibbert Tupper and Janet Macdonald.2 He married Isabel Marion Wilson on 27 September 1915.1

He gained the rank of Midshipman in the Royal navy.1 He fought in the First World War, where he was wounded.1 He gained the rank of Major in the 2nd Reserve Battalion, Seaforth Highlanders of Canada.1 He graduated with a Doctor of Law (LL.D.)1 He was appointed Queen's Counsel (Q.C.)1

Children of Reginald Hibbert Tupper and Isabel Marion Wilson

Charles Gordon Hibbert Tupper+2 b. 30 Oct 1918

David Wilson Hibbert Tupper+2 b. 18 Jun 1921

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3956. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Isabel Marion Wilson1

F, #597598, d. 1969

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Isabel Marion Wilson married Reginald Hibbert Tupper, son of Hon. Sir Charles Hibbert Tupper and Janet Macdonald, on 27 September 1915.1 She died in 1969.1

From 27 September 1915, her married name became Tupper.

Children of Isabel Marion Wilson and Reginald Hibbert Tupper

Charles Gordon Hibbert Tupper+2 b. 30 Oct 1918

David Wilson Hibbert Tupper+2 b. 18 Jun 1921

Charles Gordon Hibbert Tupper1

M, #597599, b. 30 October 1918

Last Edited=24 Mar 2019

Charles Gordon Hibbert Tupper was born on 30 October 1918.1 He is the son of Reginald Hibbert Tupper and Isabel Marion Wilson.2 He married Margaret Ada Campbell, daughter of James Albert Campbell, on 8 June 1946.1

He fought in the Second World War.1 He gained the rank of Lieutenant in the Seaforth Highlanders of Canada.1

Child of Charles Gordon Hibbert Tupper and Margaret Ada Campbell

Charles Reginald Hibbert Tupper2 b. 20 Dec 1947
